importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates when the public learned of the incident and the NTSB's preliminary report on Brett James' plane crash.
This is the date of the plane crash, which is central to the incident and the investigation into the cause of the accident.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The crash occurred on Sept. 18, 2025, marking the exact date of the event, which is critical for understanding the timeline and context of the NTSB report.

keyTakeAways: Brett James, a Grammy-winning songwriter known for working with major artists like Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, and Keith Urban, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025.
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the plane entered a 'tightening spiral' before crashing, with no mechanical issues found in the wreckage.
James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which air traffic control approved, but failed to change his radio frequency, leading to a breakdown in communication.
The controller instructed James to tune to the common traffic advisory frequency (CTAF), but he did not comply and instead announced his position at 6,800 feet and a 360-degree turn.
The aircraft, a Cirrus SR22T, flew over the runway, executed a left turn, and descended into a spiral before crashing into a field in Franklin, North Carolina.
All three people on board were killed in the crash.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Grammy-winning songwriter Brett James, known for his collaborations with major artists like Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, and Keith Urban, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, when his Cirrus SR22T aircraft entered a 'tightening spiral' after failing to maintain radio communication with air traffic control. The plane was attempting a visual approach to runway 7 at an airport near Franklin, North Carolina, where James had requested a landing. Despite being instructed to tune to the common traffic advisory frequency (CTAF), he did not change the frequency and instead announced a 360-degree turn at 6,800 feet. After flying over the runway and descending, the plane entered a spiral and crashed, killing all three people on board. The NTSB found no mechanical issues in the wreckage, pointing to a communication failure and possible pilot error as the root cause.
title: Songwriter Brett James’ plane entered a ‘tightening spiral’ before crashing, the NTSB said in a preliminary report
